citation.article-title: Acidiplasma aeolicum gen. nov., sp. nov., a euryarchaeon of the family Ferroplasmaceae isolated from a hydrothermal pool, and transfer of Ferroplasma cupricumulans to Acidiplasma cupricumulans comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acidiplasma cupricumulans (Hawkes et al. 2008) comb. nov.
Acidiplasma cupricumulans (cu.pri.cu′mu.lans. L. neut. n. cuprum copper; L. part. adj. cumulans heaping up, accumulating; N.L. part. adj. cupricumulans copper-accumulating).
Basonym: Ferroplasma cupricumulans Hawkes et al. 2008.
The description is the same as that given for Ferroplasma cupricumulans by Hawkes et al. (2006).
Morphology is as described for the genus; in addition, cells are often rod-like, with a tendency to form branched morphologies.
The type strain is strain BH2T (=DSM 16551T =JCM 13668T).
